Primitive.Name: Accumulate Images
Primitive.Comment: Stores images for combination by a subsequent primitive. Can buffer on disk for datasets too large to hold just in RAM.

Primitive.Name: Update World Coordinates
Primitive.Comment: Add wcs info, assuming target star is precisely centered.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Calibrate Photometric Flux
Primitive.Comment: Apply photometric calibration using satellite flux

Argument.Name: FinalUnits
Argument.Desc: 0:Counts, 1:Counts/s, 2:ph/s/nm/m^2, 3:Jy, 4:W/m^2/um, 5:ergs/s/cm^2/A, 6:ergs/s/cm^2/Hz

Argument.Name: CalibrationFile
Argument.Desc: Filename of the desired flux calibration file to be read

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Calibrate Photometric Flux and save convertion in DB

Argument.Name: FinalUnits
Argument.Desc: 0:Counts, 1:Counts/s, 2:ph/s/nm/m^2, 3:Jy, 4:W/m^2/um, 5:ergs/s/cm^2/A, 6:ergs/s/cm^2/Hz

Argument.Name: CalibrationFile
Argument.Desc: Filename of the desired flux calibration file to be read

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: Save_flux_convertion
Argument.Desc: 1: save flux convertion factor on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Calibrate Photometric Flux of extented object
Primitive.Comment: Apply photometric calibration of extented object

Argument.Name: FinalUnits
Argument.Desc: 0:Counts, 1:Counts/s, 2:ph/s/nm/m^2, 3:Jy, 4:W/m^2/um, 5:ergs/s/cm^2/A, 6:ergs/s/cm^2/Hz

Argument.Name: CalibrationFile
Argument.Desc: Filename of the desired flux calibration file to be read

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Calibrate Photometric Flux - Polarimetry
Primitive.Comment: Apply photometric calibration using satellite flux for polarimetry-mode data

Argument.Name: FinalUnits
Argument.Desc: 0:Counts, 1:Counts/s, 2:ph/s/nm/m^2, 3:Jy, 4:W/m^2/um, 5:ergs/s/cm^2/A, 6:ergs/s/cm^2/Hz

Argument.Name: CalibrationFile
Argument.Desc: Filename of the desired flux calibration file to be read

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Subtract Dark Background
Primitive.Comment: Subtract a dark frame.

Argument.Name: CalibrationFile
Argument.Desc: Name of dark file to subtract

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Apply Reference Pixel Correction
Primitive.Comment: Subtract channel bias levels using H2RG reference pixels.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Argument.Name: before_and_after
Argument.Desc: Show the before-and-after images for the user to see?

Argument.Name: Method
Argument.Desc: Algorithm for reference pixel subtraction.

Primitive.Name: Calibrate astrometry from binary (using separation and PA)
Primitive.Comment: Calculate astrometry from unocculted binaries using user-specified separation and PA at DATEOBS

Argument.Name: rho
Argument.Desc: Separation [arcsec] at date DATEOBS of observation of the binaries

Argument.Name: pa
Argument.Desc: Position angle [degree] at date DATEOBS of observation of the binaries

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Calibrate astrometry from binary (using 6th orbit catalog)
Primitive.Comment: Calculate astrometry from unocculted binaries; Calculate Separation and PA at date DATEOBS using the sixth orbit catalog.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Primitive.Name: Collapse datacube
Primitive.Comment: Collapse the wavelength dimension of a datacube via mean, median or total.

Argument.Name: Method
Argument.Desc: How to collapse datacube: total or median (with flux conservation)

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: ReuseOutput
Argument.Desc: 1: keep output for following primitives, 0: don't keep

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Combine 2D images and save as Thermal/Sky Background
Primitive.Comment: Combine 2D images with measurement of thermal or sky background

Argument.Name: Method
Argument.Desc: How to combine images: median, mean, or mean with outlier rejection?

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Combine 2D images
Primitive.Comment: Combine 2D images such as darks into a master file via mean or median.

Argument.Name: Method
Argument.Desc: How to combine images: median, mean, or mean with outlier rejection?

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Combine 3D cubes
Primitive.Comment: Combine 3D data cubes via mean or median.

Argument.Name: Method
Argument.Desc: How to combine images: median, mean, or mean with outlier rejection?

Argument.Name: sig_clip
Argument.Desc: Clipping value to be used with MEANCLIP in sigma (stddev)

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Combine 2D dark images
Primitive.Comment: Combine 2D dark images into a master file via mean or median.

Argument.Name: Method
Argument.Desc: How to combine images: median, mean, or mean with outlier rejection?[MEAN|MEDIAN]

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Checks quality of data based on FITS keywords.
Primitive.Comment: Control quality of data using keywords. Appropriate action for bad quality data is user-defined.

Argument.Name: Action
Argument.Desc: 0:Simple alert and continue reduction, 1:Reduction fails

Argument.Name: r0
Argument.Desc: critical r0 [m] at lambda=0.5microns

Argument.Name: rmserr
Argument.Desc: Critical rms wavefront error in microns.

Primitive.Name: Subtract Dark/Sky Background
Primitive.Comment: Subtract a dark frame.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Aggressive destripe assuming there is no signal in the image. (for darks only)
Primitive.Comment: Subtract readout pickup noise using median across all channels.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Argument.Name: before_and_after
Argument.Desc: Show the before-and-after images for the user to see? (for debugging/testing)

Primitive.Name: Destripe science frame
Primitive.Comment: Subtract detector striping using measurements between the microspectra

Argument.Name: method
Argument.Desc: Find background based on image value threshhold cut, or calibration file spectra/spot locations?

Argument.Name: abort_fraction
Argument.Desc: Necessary fraction of pixels in mask to continue - set at 0.9 to ensure quicklook tool is robust

Argument.Name: chan_offset_correction
Argument.Desc: Tries to correct for channel bias offsets - useful when no dark is available

Argument.Name: fraction
Argument.Desc: What fraction of the total pixels in a row should be masked

Argument.Name: high_limit
Argument.Desc: Pixel value where exceeding values are assigned a larger mask

Argument.Name: Save_stripes
Argument.Desc: Save the striping noise image subtracted from frame?

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: Save output to disk, 0: Don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Simple Destripe (hard-coded for I and T)
Primitive.Comment: Subtract readout pickup noise using areas far from the PSF core

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Argument.Name: before_and_after
Argument.Desc: Show the before-and-after images for the user to see?

Primitive.Name: Display raw data with GPItv
Primitive.Comment: Display, with GPItv, raw data to be processed

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0 for no display

Primitive.Name: Assemble Datacube
Primitive.Comment: Extract a 3D datacube from a 2D image (Calls assemble spectral or polarimetric cube automatically depending on input data format)

Primitive.Name: Extract one spectrum
Primitive.Comment: Extract one spectrum from a datacube somewhere in the FOV specified by the user.

Argument.Name: xcenter
Argument.Desc: x-locations in pixel on datacube where extraction will be made

Argument.Name: ycenter
Argument.Desc: y-locations in pixel on datacube where extraction will be made

Argument.Name: radius
Argument.Desc: Aperture radius (in pixel i.e. mlens) to extract photometry for each wavelength.

Argument.Name: method
Argument.Desc: method of photometry extraction:median,mean,total

Argument.Name: ps_figure
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose # of saved fig suffix name, 0: no ps figure

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output (fits) on disk, 0: don't save

Primitive.Name: Extract one spectrum, plots
Primitive.Comment: Extract one spectrum from a datacube somewhere in the FOV specified by the user.

Argument.Name: xcenter
Argument.Desc: x-locations in pixel on datacube where extraction will be made

Argument.Name: ycenter
Argument.Desc: y-locations in pixel on datacube where extraction will be made

Argument.Name: radius
Argument.Desc: Aperture radius (in pixel i.e. mlens) to extract photometry for each wavelength.

Argument.Name: method
Argument.Desc: method of photometry extraction:median,mean,total

Argument.Name: ps_figure
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose # of saved fig suffix name, 0: no ps figure

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output (fits) on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: suffix
Argument.Desc: Enter output suffix (fits)

Primitive.Name: Measure telluric transmission
Primitive.Comment: Extract Telluric transmission from satelitte spots (method 1) or from PSF signal (method 2) using theoretical star spectrum. Correct or save the transmisssion.

Argument.Name: method
Argument.Desc: 1: Use satellite flux. 2:Use clean PSF area.

Argument.Name: Correct_datacube
Argument.Desc: 1: Correct datacube from extracted tell trams., 0: don't correct

Argument.Name: Save_corrected_datacube
Argument.Desc: 1: save corrected datacube on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: Save_telluric_transmission
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: suffix
Argument.Desc: Enter output suffix

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Measure Polarization Spot Calibration
Primitive.Comment: Derive polarization calibration files from a flat field image.

Argument.Name: nlens
Argument.Desc: side length of the lenslet array

Argument.Name: centrXpos
Argument.Desc: Initial approximate x-position [pixel] of central peak at 1.5microns

Argument.Name: centrYpos
Argument.Desc: Initial approximate y-position [pixel] of central peak at 1.5microns

Argument.Name: w
Argument.Desc: Spectral spacing perpendicular to the dispersion axis at the detcetor in pixel

Argument.Name: P
Argument.Desc: Micro-pupil pattern

Argument.Name: maxpos
Argument.Desc: Allowed maximum location fluctuation (in pixel) between adjacent mlens

Argument.Name: FitWidth
Argument.Desc: Size of box around a spot used to find center

Primitive.Name: Measure Polarization Spot Calibration (parallelized)
Primitive.Comment: Derive polarization calibration files from a flat field image.

Argument.Name: nlens
Argument.Desc: side length of the lenslet array

Argument.Name: centrXpos
Argument.Desc: Initial approximate x-position [pixel] of central peak at 1.5microns

Argument.Name: centrYpos
Argument.Desc: Initial approximate y-position [pixel] of central peak at 1.5microns

Argument.Name: w
Argument.Desc: Spectral spacing perpendicular to the dispersion axis at the detcetor in pixel

Argument.Name: P
Argument.Desc: Micro-pupil pattern

Argument.Name: maxpos
Argument.Desc: Allowed maximum location fluctuation (in pixel) between adjacent mlens

Argument.Name: FitWidth
Argument.Desc: Size of box around a spot used to find center

Primitive.Name: Measure Wavelength Calibration
Primitive.Comment: Derive wavelength calibration from an arc lamp or flat-field image.

Argument.Name: nlens
Argument.Desc: side length of the lenslet array

Argument.Name: centrXpos
Argument.Desc: Initial approximate x-position [pixel] of central peak at 1.5microns

Argument.Name: centrYpos
Argument.Desc: Initial approximate y-position [pixel] of central peak at 1.5microns

Argument.Name: w
Argument.Desc: Spectral spacing perpendicular to the dispersion axis at the image center [pixel]

Argument.Name: P
Argument.Desc: Micro-pupil pattern

Argument.Name: emissionlinesfile
Argument.Desc: File of emission lines.

Argument.Name: wav_of_centrXYpos
Argument.Desc: 1 if centrX-Ypos is the smallest-wavelength peak of the band; 2 if centrX-Ypos refer to 1.5microns

Argument.Name: maxpos
Argument.Desc: Allowed maximum location fluctuation (in pixel) between adjacent mlens

Argument.Name: maxtilt
Argument.Desc: Allowed maximum tilt fluctuation (in degree) between adjacent mlens

Argument.Name: centroidmethod
Argument.Desc: Centroid method: 0 means barycentric (fast), 1 means gaussian fit (slow)

Argument.Name: medfilter
Argument.Desc: 1: Median filtering of dispersion coeff and tilts with a (5x5) median filtering

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitvim_dispgrid
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying image output and wavcal grid overplotted, 0: no display

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying wavcal file, 0: no display

Argument.Name: tests
Argument.Desc: 1 for extensive tests

Argument.Name: testsDST
Argument.Desc: 1 for DST tests

Argument.Desc: Initial approximate y-position [pixel] of central peak at 1.5microns

Argument.Name: w
Argument.Desc: Spectral spacing perpendicular to the dispersion axis at the detcetor in pixel

Argument.Name: P
Argument.Desc: Micro-pupil pattern

Argument.Name: wav_of_centrXYpos
Argument.Desc: 1 if centrX-Ypos is the smallest-wavelength peak of the band; 2 if centrX-Ypos refer to 1.5microns

Argument.Name: maxpos
Argument.Desc: Allowed maximum location fluctuation (in pixel) between adjacent mlens

Argument.Name: maxtilt
Argument.Desc: Allowed maximum tilt fluctuation (in degree) between adjacent mlens

Argument.Name: medfilter
Argument.Desc: 1: Median filtering of dispersion coeff and tilts with a (5x5) median filtering

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: suffix
Argument.Desc: Enter output suffix

Argument.Name: gpitvim_dispgrid
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying image output and wavcal grid overplotted, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Find Bad pixels from flats
Primitive.Comment: Find Hot/cold pixels using flat-field images. find deviation which is nbdev times greater or lower than the estimated value of the pixel as if it was not hot/cold.

Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Find Bad pixels from darks or qe map
Primitive.Comment: Find hot/cold pixels from qe map. Find deviants with [Intensities gt (1 + nbdev) * mean_value_of the frame] and [Intensities lt (1 - nbdev) * mean_value_of the frame]. (bad pixel =1, 0 elsewhere)

Argument.Name: nbdev
Argument.Desc: Allowed maximum location fluctuation (in pixel) between adjacent mlens

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Find Hot Pixels from a set of Darks
Primitive.Comment: Find hot pixels from a stack of dark images (best with deep integration darks)

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Measure satellite spot peak fluxes
Primitive.Comment: Calculate peak fluxes of satellite spots in datacubes

Argument.Name: gauss_fit
Argument.Desc: 0: Extract maximum pixel; 1: Correlate with Gaussian to find peak

Argument.Name: reference_index
Argument.Desc: Index of slice to use for initial satellite detection.

Argument.Name: ap_rad
Argument.Desc: Radius of aperture used for finding peaks.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Primitive.Name: Measure satellite spot locations
Primitive.Comment: Calculate locations of satellite spots in datacubes

Argument.Name: refine_fits
Argument.Desc: 0: Use wavelength scaling only; 1: Fit each slice

Argument.Name: reference_index
Argument.Desc: Index of slice to use for initial satellite detection.

Argument.Name: search_window
Argument.Desc: Radius of aperture used for locating satellite spots.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: loc_input
Argument.Desc: 0: Find spots automatically; 1: Use values below as initial satellite spot location

Argument.Name: x1
Argument.Desc: approx x-location of top left spot on central slice of the datacube in pixels (not considered if CalibrationFile is defined)

Argument.Name: y1
Argument.Desc: approx y-location of top left spot on central slice of the datacube in pixels (not considered if CalibrationFile is defined)

Argument.Name: x2
Argument.Desc: approx x-location of bottom left spot on central slice of the datacube in pixels (not considered if CalibrationFile is defined)

Argument.Name: y2
Argument.Desc: approx y-location of bottom left spot on central slice of the datacube in pixels (not considered if CalibrationFile is defined)

Argument.Name: x3
Argument.Desc: approx x-location of top right spot on central slice of the datacube in pixels (not considered if CalibrationFile is defined)

Argument.Name: y3
Argument.Desc: approx y-location of top right spot on central slice of the datacube in pixels (not considered if CalibrationFile is defined)

Argument.Name: x4
Argument.Desc: approx x-location of bottom right spot on central slice of the datacube in pixels (not considered if CalibrationFile is defined)

Argument.Name: y4
Argument.Desc: approx y-location of bottom right spot on central slice of the datacube in pixels (not considered if CalibrationFile is defined)

Primitive.Name: Plot the satellite spot locations vs. the expected location from wavelength scaling
Primitive.Comment: Measured vs. wavelength scaled sat spot locations

Argument.Name: Display
Argument.Desc: Window number to display in. -1 for no display.

Argument.Name: SaveData
Argument.Desc: Save data to filename (blank for no save)

Argument.Name: SavePNG
Argument.Desc: Save plot to filename as PNG(blank for no save)

Primitive.Name: Measure GPI distortion from grid pattern
Primitive.Comment: Measure GPI distortion from grid pattern

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: spotsnbr
Argument.Desc: How many spots in a slice of the datacube?

Primitive.Name: Median ADI data-cubes
Primitive.Comment: Median all residual ADI (or LOCI) data-cubes.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Rotate extended object
Primitive.Comment: Rotate extended object using parallactic angle for spectroscopic obs.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Speckle alignment
Primitive.Comment: This recipe rescales datacube PSF slices with respect to a chosen reference PSF slice. This routine does NOT update the data structures in memory. You MUST set the keyword SAVE to 1 or else the output is silently discarded.

Argument.Name: k
Argument.Desc: Slice of the reference PSF

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: ReuseOutput
Argument.Desc: 1: keep output for following primitives, 0: don't keep

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Rotate 2d image (90,180,270deg)
Primitive.Comment: Rotate a 2d image (90,180,270deg)

Argument.Name: Direction
Argument.Desc: Rotation Counterclockwise:0=None,1=90deg,2=180deg,3=270deg

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Interpolate Wavelength Axis
Primitive.Comment: Interpolate spectral datacube onto regular wavelength sampling.

Argument.Name: Spectralchannels
Argument.Desc: Choose how many spectral channels for output datacube

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Interpolate bad pixels in 2D frame
Primitive.Comment: Repair bad pixels by interpolating between their neighbors. Can optionally just flag as NaNs or else interpolate.

Argument.Name: CalibrationFile
Argument.Desc: Filename of the desired bad pixel file to be read

Argument.Name: method
Argument.Desc: Repair bad bix interpolating all 8 neighboring pixels, or just the 2 vertical ones, or just flag as NaN (n4n)?

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Argument.Name: before_and_after
Argument.Desc: Show the before-and-after images for the user to see? (for debugging/testing)

Argument.Name: CalibrationFile
Argument.Desc: Filename of the desired instrumental polarization file to be read

Primitive.Name: Measure the contrast
Primitive.Comment: Measure the contrast.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: Display
Argument.Desc: Window number to display in. -1 for no display.

Argument.Name: SaveProfile
Argument.Desc: Save radial profile to filename as FITS (blank for no save, dir name for default naming)

Argument.Name: SavePNG
Argument.Desc: Save plot to filename as PNG (blank for no save, dir name for default naming)

Argument.Name: contrsigma
Argument.Desc: Contrast sigma limit

Argument.Name: slice
Argument.Desc: Slice to plot. -1 for all

Argument.Name: DarkHoleOnly
Argument.Desc: 0: Plot profile in dark hole only; 1: Plot outer profile as well.

Argument.Name: contr_yunit
Argument.Desc: 0: Standard deviation; 1: Median; 2: Mean.

Argument.Name: contr_xunit
Argument.Desc: 0: Arcsec; 1: lambda/D.

Argument.Name: yscale
Argument.Desc: 0: Auto y axis scaling; 1: Manual scaling.

Argument.Name: contr_yaxis_type
Argument.Desc: 0: Linear; 1: Log

Argument.Name: contr_yaxis_min
Argument.Desc: Y axis minimum

Argument.Name: contr_yaxis_max
Argument.Desc: Y axis maximum

Argument.Name: HWPoffset
Argument.Desc: The internal offset of the HWP. If unknown set to 0

Argument.Name: IncludeSystemMueller
Argument.Desc: 1: Include, 0: Don't

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Comment: Divides a 2-slice polarimetry file by a flat field.

Argument.Desc: Filename of the desired wavelength calibration file to be read

Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Primitive.Comment: Normalize a polarimetry-mode flat field to unity.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Comment: plots using the wavelength solution

Argument.Name: ps_figure
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose # of saved fig suffix name, 0: no ps figure

Argument.Name: suffix
Argument.Desc: Enter output suffix (fits)

Primitive.Name: Load Polarimetry Spot Calibration
Primitive.Comment: Reads a pol spot calibration file from disk. This primitive is required for any polarimetry data-cube extraction.

Argument.Name: CalibrationFile
Argument.Desc: Filename of the desired wavelength calibration file to be read

Primitive.Name: Load Wavelength Calibration
Primitive.Comment: Reads a wavelength calibration file from disk. This primitive is required for any data-cube extraction.

Argument.Name: CalibrationFile
Argument.Desc: Filename of the desired wavelength calibration file to be read

Primitive.Name: Remove Flat Lamp spectrum
Primitive.Comment: Fit the lamp spectrum and remove it (for delivering flat field cubes)

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Argument.Name: method
Argument.Desc: Method to use for removing lamp spectrum

Primitive.Name: Rotate Field of View Square
Primitive.Comment: Rotate images by 26.5 degrees so that the field of view is squarely aligned with the image axes.

Argument.Name: crop
Argument.Desc: Set to 1 to crop out non-illuminated pixels

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Rotate North Up
Primitive.Comment: Rotate images so that north is up.

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Measure satellite spot flux ratios from unocculted image
Primitive.Comment: Calculate flux ratio between satellite spots and unocculted star image in a given aperture.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: tests
Argument.Desc: 1 only for DRP tests

Primitive.Name: Measure satellite spot locations with GPItv
Primitive.Comment: Calculate locations of sat.spots in datacubes (using GPItv). Do not work with the IDL Virtual Machine.

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: spotsnbr
Argument.Desc: How many spots in a slice of the datacube?

Primitive.Name: Save Output
Primitive.Comment: Save output to disk as a FITS file. Note that you can often do this from another module by setting the 'save=1' option; this is a redundant way to specify that.

Argument.Name: suffix
Argument.Desc: choose the suffix

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Set Calibration Type
Primitive.Comment: Set calibration type for recording a reduced calibration observation into the cal DB.

Argument.Name: filetype
Argument.Desc: Calibration File Type

Argument.Name: save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Shift 2D Image
Primitive.Comment: Shift 2D image, by integer or fractional pixel amounts. Doesn't shift ref pixels.

Argument.Name: dx
Argument.Desc: shift amount in X direction

Argument.Name: dy
Argument.Desc: shift amount in Y direction

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Simple SSDI
Primitive.Comment: Apply SSDI to create a 2D subtracted image from a cube. Given the user's specified wavelength ranges, extract the 3D datacube slices for each of those wavelength ranges. Collapse these down into 2D images by simply averaging the values at each lenslet (ignoring NANs). Rescale Image1, then compute diffImage = I1scaled - k* I2

Argument.Name: L1Min
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 1, minimum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: L1Max
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 1, maximum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: L2Min
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 2, minimum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: L2Max
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 2, maximum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: k
Argument.Desc: Scaling factor of Intensity(wav_range2) with diffImage = I1scaled - k* I2

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: ReuseOutput
Argument.Desc: 1: keep output for following primitives, 0: don't keep

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Name: Simple SSDI of median ADI residual
Primitive.Comment: Apply SSDI to create a 2D subtracted image from a cube. Given the user's specified wavelength ranges, extract the 3D datacube slices for each of those wavelength ranges. Collapse these down into 2D images by simply averaging the values at each lenslet (ignoring NANs). Rescale Image1, then compute diffImage = I1scaled - k* I2

Argument.Name: L1Min
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 1, minimum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: L1Max
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 1, maximum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: L2Min
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 2, minimum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: L2Max
Argument.Desc: Wavelength range 2, maximum wavelength [in microns]

Argument.Name: k
Argument.Desc: Scaling factor of Intensity(wav_range2) with diffImage = I1scaled - k* I2

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: save output on disk, 0: don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display

Primitive.Comment: Divides a spectral data-cube by a flat field data-cube.

Primitive.Name: Subtract background from 2D raw image
Primitive.Comment: Subtract 2D background based on the regions in between the spectra

Argument.Name: method
Argument.Desc: Find background based on image value threshhold cut, or calibration file spectra/spot locations?

Argument.Name: abort_fraction
Argument.Desc: Necessary fraction of pixels in mask to continue - set at 0.9 to ensure quicklook tool is robust

Argument.Name: chan_offset_correction
Argument.Desc: Tries to correct for channel bias offsets - useful when no dark is available

Argument.Name: fraction
Argument.Desc: What fraction of the total pixels in a row should be masked

Argument.Name: high_limit
Argument.Desc: Pixel value where exceeding values are assigned a larger mask

Argument.Name: Save_stripes
Argument.Desc: Save the striping noise image subtracted from frame?

Argument.Name: Save
Argument.Desc: 1: Save output to disk, 0: Don't save

Argument.Name: gpitv
Argument.Desc: 1-500: choose gpitv session for displaying output, 0: no display
